trashday

Class TrashDayManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • trashday.TrashDayManager

  • public class TrashDayManager
extends Object
    Handles the core application logic. The TrashDaySpeechlet received the Intents from the user and calls appropriate methods in this class. Methods in this class interact with the user's pickup schedule and select an appropriate Alexa SpeechletResponse.
    Author:
    J. Todd Baldwin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TrashDayManager(AmazonDynamoDBClient amazonDynamoDbClient, String tableNameOverride)
      Create manager object to handle mapping user intents to application actions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrashDayManager

        public TrashDayManager(AmazonDynamoDBClient amazonDynamoDbClient,
                       String tableNameOverride)
        Create manager object to handle mapping user intents to application actions. Methods will usually perform some action on the user's pickup schedule and then will return verbal response from the classes in the trashday.ui.responses package.
        Parameters:
        amazonDynamoDbClient - AmazonDynamoDBClient connection for the Dynamo DB holding our schedule data.
        tableNameOverride - String table name used by JUnit tests to ensure they do not write to the Production table name (which is hard-coded using @DynamoDBTable in DynamoItem). A null value indicates no override. Any other value is the Dynamo table name to be used.

        Find a LocalDateTime for the given user LaunchRequest and TimeZone.
        Parameters:

        timeZone - TimeZone the user has configured

      • isConfigurationComplete

        protected SpeechletResponse isConfigurationComplete()
        For handlers that require user time zone and schedule data to exist, use this method to load the information from the Session or from Dynomo DB. If data is missing, respond to user with prompts to add this information.
        Returns:
        SpeechletResponse null if configuration is complete. Otherwise, a SpeechletResponse prompting the user to add the missing information.

      • isTimeZoneConfigurationComplete

        protected SpeechletResponse isTimeZoneConfigurationComplete()
        For handlers that require user time zone data to exist, use this method to load the information from the Session or from Dynomo DB. If data is missing, respond to user with prompts to add this information.
        Returns:
        SpeechletResponse null if time zone configuration is complete. Otherwise, a SpeechletResponse prompting the user to add the missing information.

      • flushIntentLog

        public void flushIntentLog(Session session)
        Flush any intent log data that has accumulated in the current user's session attributes to their correct Dynamo DB item.
        Parameters:
        session - Session for this request

      • flushIntentLog

        protected void flushIntentLog()
        Flush any intent log data that has accumulated in the current user's session attributes to their correct Dynamo DB item. Use the current sessionDao.

      • handleLaunchRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleLaunchRequest(LaunchRequest request,
                                             Session session)
        Respond when the user says "Open Trash Day"

        Use isConfigurationComplete() to load the pickup schedule from the user's Session or, if not available, from the Dynamo DB. If no schedule available respond with instructions to add to the schedule. If there is an existing schedule, give a short menu of possible user commands.

        Parameters:
        request - LaunchRequest Use the time this request was received from the user.
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Recite a short menu of possible actions the user can perform.

      • handleUpdateScheduleRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleUpdateScheduleRequest(IntentRequest request,
                                                     Session session)
        Respond when the user says "Change Schedule"

        Set the "Schedule Change In Progress" flag on the user's Session and respond with a prompt for a schedule change command.

        Parameters:
        request - LaunchRequest Use the time this request was received from the user.
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        A prompt for schedule change commands.

      • handleTellNextPickupRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleTellNextPickupRequest(IntentRequest request,
                                                     Session session)
        Respond when the user asks for the next pickup time for one or all of the scheduled pickups.

        Use isConfigurationComplete() to load the pickup schedule from the Session or Dynamo DB, if it exists. Respond with instructions to add to the schedule if the schedule is missing or empty. If there is no requested pickup name, calculate and recite the next pickup time for all pickups in the schedule. If given a specific pickup name, just calculate and recite the next time for that pickup.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest Use the time this request was received from the user.
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Recite the next pickup(s) time(s) or note the schedule is missing/empty

      • handleTellScheduleRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleTellScheduleRequest(IntentRequest request,
                                                   Session session)
        Respond when the user asks to hear the entire pickup schedule.

        Use isConfigurationComplete() to load the pickup schedule from the Session or Dynamo DB, if it exists. Respond with instructions to add to the schedule if the schedule is missing or empty. Otherwise, recite the schedule to the user.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest Use the time this request was received from the user.
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Recite the existing schedule or note the schedule is missing/empty

      • handleSetTimeZoneRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleSetTimeZoneRequest(IntentRequest request,
                                                  Session session)
        Respond when the user tries to set the time zone.
        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest Use the time zone slot provided by this user request to find a correct TimeZone and store it for this suer.
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Complain and possibly send a Time Zone Help Card if the time zone information can't be mapped to a good TimeZone. If we get good time zone information, set it in the Alexa session and this user's Dynamo DB storage entry.

      • handleAddPickupRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleAddPickupRequest(IntentRequest request,
                                                Session session)
        Respond when the user adds a (weekly) pickup time into the schedule.

        Use isTimeZoneConfigurationComplete() to load the time zone from the Session or Dynamo DB. If not available, prompt the user to set the time zone. If time zone is available, check for any missing or invalid data in the request and respond appropriately so the user can correct and try again. Once all required data is available, use Calendar.pickupAddWeekly(LocalDateTime, String, DayOfWeek, LocalTime) to add a named pickup at a given day-of-week and time-of-day (creating a new schedule if needed). Save the updated schedule to Dynamo DB and let the user know the addition was made.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Complain if any required data is missing or invalid. Otherwise, make the schedule addition and let the user know.

Save the updated schedule to Dynamo DB and let the user know the addition was made.

      • handleDeletePickupRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleDeletePickupRequest(IntentRequest request,
                                                   Session session)
        Respond when the user deletes a (weekly) pickup time from the schedule.

        Use isTimeZoneConfigurationComplete() to load the time zone from the Session or Dynamo DB. If not available, prompt the user to set the time zone. If time zone is available, check for any missing or invalid data in the request and respond appropriately so the user can correct and try again. Once all required data is available, use Calendar.pickupDeleteWeekly(String, DayOfWeek, LocalTime) to remove a pickup at a given day-of-week and time-of-day (creating a new schedule if needed). Save the updated schedule to Dynamo DB if needed and let the user know if a removal was made.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Complain if any required data is missing or invalid. Otherwise, make the schedule deletion and let the user know if an entry was actually removed.

      • handleDeleteBiWeeklyPickupRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleDeleteBiWeeklyPickupRequest(IntentRequest request,
                                                           Session session)
        Respond when the user deletes a biweekly pickup time from the schedule.

        Use isTimeZoneConfigurationComplete() to load the time zone from the Session or Dynamo DB. If not available, prompt the user to set the time zone. If time zone is available, check for any missing or invalid data in the request and respond appropriately so the user can correct and try again. Once all required data is available, use Calendar.pickupDeleteBiWeekly(String, DayOfWeek, LocalTime) to remove a pickup at a given day-of-week and time-of-day (creating a new schedule if needed). Save the updated schedule to Dynamo DB if needed and let the user know if a removal was made.

        NOTE: A biweekly delete request may delete two entries from the schedule. This makes it easier for the user to not have to know whether an event is due on this day-of-week vs. next day-of-week when making the delete request. It's a user interface assumption that overlapping biweekly pickups are probably not named the same. For example, "biweekly recycling pickup on Tuesday at noon (this coming Tuesday)" and "biweekly lawn waste pickup on Tuesday at noon (the following Tuesday)".

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Complain if any required data is missing or invalid. Otherwise, make the schedule deletion and let the user know if an entry was actually removed.

      • handleDeleteMonthlyPickupRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleDeleteMonthlyPickupRequest(IntentRequest request,
                                                          Session session)
        Respond when the user deletes a monthly pickup time from the schedule.

        Use isTimeZoneConfigurationComplete() to load the time zone from the Session or Dynamo DB. If not available, prompt the user to set the time zone. If time zone is available, check for any missing or invalid data in the request and respond appropriately so the user can correct and try again. Once all required data is available, use Calendar.pickupDeleteDayOfMonth(String, Integer, LocalTime) to remove a pickup at a given day-of-month and time-of-day (creating a new schedule if needed). Save the updated schedule to Dynamo DB if needed and let the user know if a removal was made.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this request

        public SpeechletResponse handleDeleteMonthlyLastNWeekdayPickupRequest(IntentRequest request,
                                                                      Session session)
        Respond when the user deletes a Nth to last weekday-of-monthly pickup time from the schedule.

        Use isTimeZoneConfigurationComplete() to load the time zone from the Session or Dynamo DB. If not available, prompt the user to set the time zone. If time zone is available, check for any missing or invalid data in the request and respond appropriately so the user can correct and try again.       • handleDeleteEntirePickupRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleDeleteEntirePickupRequest(IntentRequest request,
                                                         Session session)
        Respond when the user deletes an entire pickup name from the schedule.

        Use isTimeZoneConfigurationComplete() to load the time zone from the Session or Dynamo DB. If not available, prompt the user to set the time zone. If time zone is available, check for any missing or invalid data in the request and respond appropriately so the user can correct and try again. Once all required data is available, use Calendar.pickupDelete(String) to remove all pickups under a given name (e.g. "trash", "mail", etc.) (creating a new schedule if needed). Save the updated schedule to Dynamo DB if needed and let the user know if a removal was made.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Complain if any required data is missing or invalid. Otherwise, make the schedule deletion and let the user know if an entry was actually removed.

      • handleDeleteEntireScheduleRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleDeleteEntireScheduleRequest(IntentRequest request,
                                                           Session session)
        Respond when the user deletes the entire schedule.

        Load only the pickup schedule from the Session or Dynamo DB, if it exists. If the schedule is already empty, let the user know it is already cleared. If schedule is available, we require a confirmation from the user. So store confirmation data in the SessionDao to delete the entire schedule and then ask the user to confirm the schedule delete. The user will respond with a Yes/No answer that will be handled by handleYesRequest(IntentRequest, Session). That handler will (or will not) perform the delete entire schedule action.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Remove an entire pickup from the schedule and let the user know. Otherwise, complain about any missing or invalid data from the user.
        See Also:
        handleYesRequest(IntentRequest, Session)

      • handleHelpRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleHelpRequest(IntentRequest request,
                                           Session session)
        Respond when the user says "Help." Give verbal and card-based help for how to use the Trash Day application and commands the user can give to Trash Day.
        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this Yes/No request
        Returns:
        Commands to Add, Delete, and Query the weekly pickup schedule.

      • handleYesRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleYesRequest(IntentRequest request,
                                          Session session)
        Respond when the user gives a Yes or No.

        For some interactions, our application needs to ask the user for a Yes/No answer. Specifically, handleDeleteEntireScheduleRequest(IntentRequest, Session) needs to ask, "Are you sure you want to delete the entire schedule?" When we ask the user a Yes/No question, we record in the session an intent corresponding to the question we asked (SessionDao.SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_INTENT) and a description of the action we're contemplating (SessionDao.SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_DESC).

        When the user gives a "Yes" response, we generate a specific response based on the SessionDao.SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_INTENT. We return helpful messages when a question has not already been asked or the code does not understand how to perform a given intent (code error).

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this Yes/No request
        Returns:
        a generic "Cancelled" response or a perform a specific action corresponding to a previously stored intent

      • handleNoRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleNoRequest(Session session)
        Respond when the user gives a No.

        For some interactions, our application needs to ask the user for a Yes/No answer. Specifically, handleDeleteEntireScheduleRequest(IntentRequest, Session) needs to ask, "Are you sure you want to delete the entire schedule?" When we ask the user a Yes/No question, we record in the session an intent corresponding to the question we asked (SessionDao.SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_INTENT) and a description of the action we're contemplating (SessionDao.SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_DESC).

        When the user gives a "No" response, we return a generic "Cancelled" response using the description from SessionDao.SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_DESC. We return a helpful message when a question has not already been asked.

        Parameters:
        session - Session for this Yes/No request
        Returns:
        a generic "Cancelled" response or a perform a specific action corresponding to a previously stored intent

      • handleExitRequest

        public SpeechletResponse handleExitRequest(Session session)
        Respond when the user says "Stop" or "Cancel"

        If we had just asked the user a question, take a Stop/Cancel as a "No" answer. Cleanup and respond appropriately. Otherwise, simply exit with a "Goodbye" message.

        Parameters:
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        response for the Stop or Cancel intent
